text.0: i have enriched the singer with surpassing wealth i have allowed the holy hymn to strengthen me.
text.1: i furtherer of him who offers sacrifice have conquered in each fight the men who worship not.
text.2: the people of the heavens the waters and the earth have stablished me among the gods with indras name.
text.3: i took unto myself the two swift vigorous bays that speed on divers paths and the fierce bolt for strength.
text.4: with deadly blows i smote atka for kavis sake i guarded kutsa well with these saving helps.
text.5: as Śuṣṇas slayer i brandished the dart of death i gave not up the Āryan name to dasyu foes.
text.6: smadibha tugra and the vetasus i gave as prey to kutsa fatherlike to succour him.
text.7: i was a worthy king to rule the worshipper when i gave tuji dear inviolable gifts.
text.8: i gave up mṛgaya to srutarvan as his prey because he ever followed me and kept my laws.
text.9: for Āyus sake i caused veta to bend and bow and into savyas hand delivered padgrbhi.
text.10: i crushed navavāstva of the lofty car the dāsa as the vṛtraslayer kills the fiends.
text.11: when straightway on the regions farthest edge i brought the god who makes the lights to broaden and increase.
text.12: i travel round about borne onward in my might by the fleetfooted dappled horses of the sun.
text.13: when mans libation calls me to the robe of state i soon repel the powerful dasyu with my blows.
text.14: stronger am i than nabus i who slew the seven i glorified with might yadu and turvaga.
text.15: i brought another low with strength i bent his strength i let the mighty nineandninety wax in power.
text.16: bull over all the streams that flow along the earth i took the seven rivers as mine own domain.
text.17: i gifted with great wisdom spread the floods abroad by war i found for man the way to high success.
text.18: i set within these cows the white milk which no god not even tvaṣṭars self had there deposited.
text.19: muchlongedfor in the breasts the udders of the kine the savoury sweets of meath the milk and soma juice.
text.20: even thus hath indra maghavan truly bounteous sped gods and men with mighty operation.
text.21: the pious glorify all these thine exploits lord of bay coursers strong and selfresplendent.
